abstract: The Treasury Department is pushing the company to cut the big pay incentives it contends were needed to keep staff but which stoked a controversy over compensation at taxpayer-supported companies.
snippet: The Treasury Department is pushing the company to cut the big pay incentives it contends were needed to keep staff but which stoked a controversy over compensation at taxpayer-supported companies.
lead_paragraph: Update | 6:42 p.m. The special federal paymaster is trying to persuade the American International Group, the insurance giant, to reduce a coming bonus payment of $198 million, but he is running into legal hurdles despite rules curtailing bonuses at companies receiving assistance from the Treasury, Mary Williams Walsh of The New York Times reports.

headline.main: U.S. Wants A.I.G. to Cut Back Some Bonuses
